Its the same thing as laws prohibiting uneducated folks from unthinkingly hauling firewood from one place to another.
There are these things (better go to the library and see if you can't get a dictionary first) called 
invasive species
for which this law is intended to diminish the spread.
If laws like this had been in years ago we might not have zebra mussels now. 
If laws about not hauling firewood around the country had existed, the Emerald Ash Borer beetle might not have spread as aggressively. 
If laws constraining importation of foreign plants had existed many decades ago we wouldn't have Giant Hogweed plants growing all over the place now. 
And this law is just the tip of the iceberg. With varying speed and diligence virtually all states and even nations will continue to pass more and more laws to try and slow down the spread of non-native plants, animals and microorganisms around the world into places they don't belong. 
So yes, in the meantime I hope ignorant folks like you sell all your boats and other watercraft, are prohibited from driving your truck full of firewood out of state, and are denied the ability to buy any creatures from a pet store that aren't native to our state. 
And no, this isn't a case of government overreach, in case you or other readers want to hide behind your limited understanding of libertarian concepts. This is a case of the government belatedly passing laws they should have been putting forth at least 30 years ago: it's long overdue.

I have learned that the majority of the people whom enter your life, more times then not, do not stay in your life. On the contrary, they will likely give up on you or go searching for someone, who they deem, better then you. 
 As a child, I was a very sensitive and emotional young boy. It was so easy to break my heart, that it would happen often. 
 At the age of 16 I met this pretty little girl and WOW, how I fell for her. She was promptly given everything, including my heart. I was so naive and impressionable that I was entirely clueless of what dangers were lurking. I really believed everything was all rainbows and butterflies. ** When I donate it is to charities that are based here in the Valley that give back to our community. The free store, the hospital thrift and the Community thrift are stores that actually help the poor. **

Sorry dude, you gave your partner the herps.  If i were you id start praying that they dont sue you....
Transmission is caused by close oral, anal, or genital contact, including intercourse, masturbation, kissing, or any direct skin-to-skin contact which allows for the transfer of bodily fluids.
A person is considered contagious when prodromal symptoms, active sores, and healing lesions are present.
Herpes is potentially contagious when no symptoms are present. That is, a person who has genital herpes is potentially always shedding active virus.
Approximately 1 in 6 members of the general infected population is thought to shed active virus occasionally without symptoms.
Some people do not get typical blister-like sores but harbor active virus in their saliva, vaginal, or penile secretions, and can shed the virus without knowing they have herpes.
Lesions can occur deep inside the vagina where they cannot be seen or felt, but can readily transmit the virus.
An uninfected individual has about a 75% chance of contracting herpes during intimate contact with someone actively shedding virus.
Oral herpes can be transmitted to the genitals, and vice versa. Symptoms are similar.
http://www.herpes.com/genitalinfo.shtml

They also have to tell SSA when this information changes--for example, when they move, or start working. 
The vast majority of beneficiaries--and representative payees--do give accurate information, and they try to comply fully with SSA's reporting requirements. But sometimes, people lie to or hide things from SSA so they can keep their benefits--and those who do are not just stealing from SSA, but from the people who rely on that money to meet basic needs, like food and housing. This matter was investigated by the Internal Revenue Service -- Criminal Investigation Division, and the Social Security Administration, Office of Inspector General -- Office of Investigations. The case open and waiting on the Insector General to talk to a witness that will be available NOW ITS SEPT 15
2014 Fines
The first type of penalty someone found guilty of committing Social Security fraud faces is a monetary fine. Section 143.2 of the Social Security Handbook states that the monetary fine will range from $500 to $10,000. The specific fine imposed will depend on which law is violated. The government also can sentence the defendant to imprisonment.
Imprisonment
The second kind of penalty typically imposed on individuals found guilty of Social Security fraud is physical imprisonment. According to Section 143.2 of the Social Security Handbook, imprisonment can range from one year to as many as 15 years, depending on the nature of the law violated. The government additionally can impose monetary fines on the defendant.
Restitution
Federal law also allows courts to impose further monetary penalties against those found guilty of defrauding the Social Security system in the form of restitution to the Commissioner of Social Security. For this to occur, however, the offense must have caused Social Security benefits to have been wrongfully paid or an individual to have suffered financial loss because of the defendant's fraudulent action while serving as the affected individual's representative payee. THE PLAN - There is no plan...   Actually, there is a plan but it changes all the time!  So many dream of a grand sailing adventure but never leave... How about really leaving this coming season?  Start with some of the Caribbean and then start heading west.  Cartagena, San Blas, through the canal and to the more remote parts of the South Pacific.  Use Hawaii as a base to see the far west portion of the Pacific.  
THE BOAT -   A 33 foot mono hull designed and built to offshore standards for two people.  Equipped with the necessary safety and communications equipment for extended offshore passage making.
THE GUY - I am fit, liberal, sane, non drinker, never married, no kids, and very down to earth.   I enjoy books, ideas, sitting still and doing the wholesome kind of nothing like appreciating the peace of being out on the water.  I can be analytical but am even more "aware." I have spent a lot of time outside of the United States so I have a good sense of how the normal standard of living in the U.S. is incredibly excessive.   More bohemian than hippie and not a pot smoker.  I have recently learned to surf so looking for spots with the boat is a side activity as well as learning Spanish.  I have an exceptional amount of experience with sailing and voyaging and have done most of it "single handed".  I am over that and would love to do it as a team. 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  
THE REALITY -  I think it would be a little crazy to just take off on an offshore sailing trip with someone that you just met online.  If you are reading this and thinking it might turn out to be sketchy, rest assured, it is the same from this end.  I am just as picky as to whom I would go offshore with.  A voyage on a small boat requires more than just good chemistry.  There are a lot of stresses and responsibilities that would never come up in a land based relationship.  But this is part of the adventure!  The key is to start up slowly.  No expectations, just initially meet up for tea or a walk and then hang out. There is plenty of easy sailing right here in the Keys.  No need to jump into anything big.... 
Ideally, you would know something about boats and sailing.  This is not a requirement but it sure helps.  You should be fit and have an off the grid and simple living sensibility.  A love of the ocean and a desire for some "out of the box" style of traveling.
